discussion.content: Workers : Powerapps Portal
Teams and Portals. Business Voice doesn't exist anymore.

Workers must be able to communicate in near real-time with worker support agents. - Power Apps Portal will not be able to do that.

Business Voice retired June 2022. Customers wishing to continue with the existing service should transition to the new licensing plan.
The following add on licenses are recommended for the transition:
Microsoft Teams Phone Standard for a cloud-based Phone System in Microsoft Teams.
Audio Conferencing for dial-in and dial-out conferencing for meetings.
Microsoft Teams Calling Plans for domestic calls to Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) connectivity.

I can imagine that the question would be revised to include any of these

Hmm... why not Teams for both options?
"The solution must support near real-time communications between workers and recruiters."
Teams, Portals for sure.
Business Voice exists. But the reason that would be out of right answers is that in the requirement they were looking for translation capabilities that which power apps portal can provide.
Teams and PoweApps portals

Microsoft 365 Business Voice was Microsoft’s telephony service bundle for small and medium businesses, which included Private Branch Exchange (PBX) capabilities, a domestic calling plan, and Audio Conferencing. However, Business Voice will be deprecated on March 1, 2022. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/business-voice/whats-business-voice. So I would then choose Power Apps Portals.
